result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Douglas Tree was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying a Concealed Knife [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.231.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Steven Douglas Tree in court.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Steven Douglas Tree.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Sauder Informs the court this matter is resolved and files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the court.
Defendant enters plea of "NO CONTEST" .
Court questions defendant re: his plea and waiver of rights.
Court questions attorney Sauder re: her clients plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY". 

State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney Sauder joins in the motion.

Court Orders: $300.00 Fine + Costs
